properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 4:28AM PST until January 21 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON...

.A cold front will bring widespread precipitation to northwest
California tonight into Tuesday. Snow levels will fall from 5000
feet to 4000 feet during Tuesday. This will result in mostly rain
and wet road conditions across the passes of Highway 299, and just
minor accumulations, if any, along Highway 36. However, up to a
foot of snow will be possible at Scott Mountain Summit on Highway
3.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14
inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County including Scott Mountain Summit
on Highway 3.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 3 PM Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Chain
requirements over Scott Mountain Summit and periods of road
closure are possible. Blowing and drifting snow could make
visibility poor.
properties.instruction:
Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. If you must travel,
carry an emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries,
blankets, food, water, and medications.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM TUESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET
